brain_mask_utils module¶

brain_mask_utils.extract_multiple_regions_mask(mask, regions)¶

Extracts multiple regions from a mask.

Parameters

  • mask (numpy.ndarray) – The mask.

  • regions (list) – Regions to be extracted.

Returns

region_mask – Region specific mask. Same shape as input mask.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

brain_mask_utils.extract_region(img, region_mask, gpu)¶

Extracts region(s) from a given images using a mask.

Parameters

  • img (numpy.ndarray/torch.tensor) – 5D data of a batch of nifti image(s). Dimension expected to be B, C, H, W, D

  • region_mask (numpy.ndarray) – The region mask.

  • gpu (int/str) – GPU number.

Returns

patch

Return type

numpy.ndarray

See also

get_mask()

Loads the data from a given mask.

brain_mask_utils.extract_region_mask(mask, region_name)¶

Extracts a given region from the mask.

Parameters

  • mask (numpy.ndarray) – The mask.

  • region_name (str) – A region name. For available regions please read the documentation.

Returns

region_mask – Region specific mask. Same shape as input mask.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

brain_mask_utils.get_mask(mask_path)¶

Loads the data from a given mask.

Parameters

mask_path (str) – Path to the mask.

Returns

Data of the given mask.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

brain_mask_utils.rescale_mask(target_image_path, neuromorph_map_path)¶

Rescales a given neuromorphological mask to a new affine.

Parameters

  • target_image_path (str) – path to the target image. Affine and shape used as template to rescale mask.

  • neuromorph_map_path (str) –

Returns

nmm_mask

Return type

nibabel.Nifti1Image

nitorch
